title: Manchester United transfer news: Virgil van Dijk given answer over summer move | Metro News
text:
Follow us Southampton warn Virgil van Dijk he will not be sold to Liverpool or Manchester United this summer Coral Barry for Metro.co.uk Monday 27 Feb 2017 8:47 pm Virgil van Dijk has attracted the attentions of several Premier League clubs (Picture: Getty) 
Southampton have told Virgil van Dijk that he will not be moving away from the club this summer. Jurgen Klopp sends warning to his Liverpool flops after Leicester loss 
The Saints centre-back has been continually linked with a move away from St Mary’s in the past 12 months with Liverpool and Manchester United reportedly interested in signing Van Dijk. 
Van Dijk is thought to be at the top of Jose Mourinho’s defensive wishlist while Jurgen Klopp is still searching for the perfect centre-back mix at Anfield. 
However, Saints chief executive Ralph Krueger has insisted Van Dijk remains committed to the club as their captain. Manchester United fixtures 
Bournemouth (H) – Sat 4 Mar FC Rostov – Europa (A) – Thu 9 Mar Chelsea – FA Cup (A) – Mon 13 Mar FC Rostov – Europa (H) – Thu 16 Mar Middlesbrough (A) – Sun 19 Mar West Brom (H) – Sat 1 Apr Everton (H) – Tue 4 Apr Sunderland (A) – Sat 8 Apr Manchester United have been heavily linked with Van Dijk since last summer (Picture: Getty) 
‘Virgil is committed to us for a long time and we don’t see anything but that in our future,’ Krueger told TalkSport . 
‘We will be sitting together in a few weeks to look at our summer transfer window and what the plans are. 
‘At the moment, Virgil is very committed to us. He is our team captain and we see him in our red and white stripes.’ Van Dijk is under contract at Southampton until 2022 (Picture: Getty)
